subject: Writing
title: Chinese Characters
description: A micro-lesson that makes Chinese Characters usable.

hook.text: Chinese writing has over 50,000 characters, yet most people use about 3,000 daily.

buildup.text: Oracle bone script from 1200 BCE is the oldest verified Chinese writing â€” carved on turtle shells.

discovery.text: Unlike alphabets, each Chinese character represents a meaning or word, not a single sound.

twist.text: This means speakers of different Chinese dialects can read the same text without understanding each other.

climax.text: Chinese characters unified a vast empire linguistically, even when spoken languages diverged.

punchline.text: One writing system, a billion readers, countless tongues.
